sen.j: 日本の市
自治体名京田辺市
都道府県京都府
城陽市綴喜郡井手町、相楽郡精華町大阪府枚方市奈良県生駒市
sen.e: Jouyou City, Tsuzuki-gun, Ide-chou; Souraku-gun, Seika-chou; Osaka Metropolitan Area, Hirakata City; Nara Prefecture, Ikoma City
Jouyou City, Tsuzuki-gun Ide-chou (Town); Souraku-gun Seika-chou (Town); Osaka Prefecture, Hirakata City; Nara Prefecture, Ikoma City
sen.cmt: Osaka Metropolitan Area→Osaka Prefectureに修正。 ※chou→Townの意味を追加。
sen.e: Jouyou City, Tsuzuki-gun Ide-chou (Town); Souraku-gun Seika-chou (Town); Osaka Prefecture, Hirakata City; Nara Prefecture, Ikoma City

sen.j: 所在地京田辺市田辺80番地
外部リンク
経度東経135度46分4秒
緯度北緯34度48分51秒
京田辺市（きょうたなべし）は、京都府南部の大阪府・奈良県との県境近くに位置する市。
sen.e: Kyoutanabe City is a city in the southern part of the Kyoto Metropolitan Area, located near the border with Osaka Metropolitan Area and Nara Prefecture.
Kyoutanabe City is a city in the southern part of Kyoto Prefecture, located near the border with Osaka Prefecture and Nara Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 京都府、大阪府をKyoto,Osaka Prefectureに修正。
sen.e: Kyoutanabe City is a city in the southern part of Kyoto Prefecture, located near the border with Osaka Prefecture and Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 地理
京田辺市は京都府南部、八幡市・城陽市・綴喜郡井手町・相楽郡精華町・大阪府枚方市・奈良県生駒市と接し、三府県の三角地帯の中央部に位置する。
sen.e: Kyoutanabe is in the southern part of the Kyoto Metropolitan Area near the cities of Hachiman and Jouyou, and the towns of Tsuzuki Ide and Souraku-gun Seika-chou, as well as Hirakata City in the Osaka Metropolitan Area, and Ikekoma City in Nara Prefecture; it is located at the intersection of three prefectures/metropolitan areas.

Kyoutanabe is in the southern part of Kyoto Prefecture near the cities of Yawata and Jouyou, and the towns of Tsuzuki-gun Ide and Souraku-gun Seika, as well as Hirakata City in Osaka Prefecture, and Ikoma City in Nara Prefecture; it is located at the intersection of three prefectures.
sen.cmt: 京都府、大阪府をKyoto,Osaka Prefectureに修正。 Hachiman→Yawataが正しい。 Tsuzuki Ide→Tsuzuki-gun Ide 先にTownとあるので、Souraku-gun Seika-chouからchouを削除。 Ikekoma→Ikomaが正しい。
sen.e: Kyoutanabe is in the southern part of Kyoto Prefecture near the cities of Yawata and Jouyou, and the towns of Tsuzuki-gun Ide and Souraku-gun Seika, as well as Hirakata City in Osaka Prefecture, and Ikoma City in Nara Prefecture; it is located at the intersection of three prefectures.

sen.j: 市の東側を南北に沿って流れる木津川 (京都府)と、西側の生駒山系に挟まれており、中心部を西日本旅客鉄道片町線・近畿日本鉄道近鉄京都線が通る。
sen.e: The city is in between the Kizu River to the east, which runs north-south, and the Ikekoma mountains to the west; and the West Japan Passenger Railway Katamachi Line and the Kintetsu Kyoto Line run through the middle of the city.

The city is in between the Kizu River to the east, which runs north-south, and the Ikoma mountains to the west; and the West Japan Railway Katamachi Line and the Kintetsu Kyoto Line run through the middle of the city.
sen.cmt: Ikekoma→Ikomaが正しい。JRの英語表記に無いので、 West Japan Passenger Railway Katamachi Lineから、Passengerを削除。
sen.e: The city is in between the Kizu River to the east, which runs north-south, and the Ikoma mountains to the west; and the West Japan Railway Katamachi Line and the Kintetsu Kyoto Line run through the middle of the city.

sen.j: 京都市・奈良市・大阪市のベッドタウンとしての性格が強い。
sen.e: It is a characteristic bedroom community for the cities of Kyoto, Nara, and Osaka.
It is a characteristic bedroom community for the cities of Kyoto, Nara, and Osaka.
It is a characteristic bedroom community for the cities of Kyoto, Nara, and Osaka.

sen.j: 人口
行政
市長：石井明三（1選目）
歴史
1997年（平成9年）4月1日、 綴喜郡田辺町より市制施行。
sen.e: April 1 1997 (Heisei year 9) - The City was formed from Tsuzuki Tanabe Town.
April 1 1997 (Heisei year 9) - The City was formed from Tsuzuki -gun Tanabe Chou (Town).
April 1 1997 - The City was formed from Tsuzuki -gun Tanabe Chou (Town).

sen.j: 京都府で八幡市以来20年振り12番目、全国で669番目の市として誕生した。
sen.e: It became the 12th city in the Kyoto Metropolitan Area, the first in 20 years after Hachiman City, and the 669th City nationwide.
It became the 12th city in Kyoto Prefecture, the first in 20 years after Yawata City, and the 669th City nationwide.
sen.cmt: 京都府をKyoto Prefectureに修正。Hachiman→Yawataが正しい。
sen.e: It became the 12th city in Kyoto Prefecture, the first in 20 years after Yawata City, and the 669th City nationwide.

sen.j: その際和歌山県田辺市との重複を避けるため、京都府の「京」を冠して『京田辺市』となった京都府綴喜郡田辺町を「京都府田辺市」とする町を市とする処分（市制施行）と、「京都府田辺市」を「京都府京田辺市」とする市の名称変更が、同日に実施されている。
sen.e: Kyoto Tsuzuki-gun Tanabe Town was made a city by the name of Kyoto Tanabe City, in order to avoid confusion with Tanabe City in Wakayama Prefecture, and then had its name changed to Kyoto Kyoutanabe City the same day.

Kyoto Tsuzuki-gun Tanabe Chou (Town) was made a city by the name of Kyoto Tanabe City, in order to avoid confusion with Tanabe City in Wakayama Prefecture, and then had its name changed to Kyoto Kyoutanabe City (it was added "Kyo"of Kyoto) the same day.
sen.cmt: 他と表記を統一する為、Chouを追加。内容的にTownが必要なので残す。京都の「京」を付け加えた事を補足。
sen.e: Kyoto Tsuzuki-gun Tanabe Chou (Town) was made a city by the name of Kyoto Tanabe City, in order to avoid confusion with Tanabe City in Wakayama Prefecture, and then had its name changed to Kyoto Kyoutanabe City (it was added "Kyo"of Kyoto) the same day.

sen.j: なお、新市名は一般公募から選考されたものである。
sen.e: The city name was chosen from submissions from the public.
The city name was chosen from submissions from the public.
The city name was chosen from submissions from the public.

sen.j: 茶（宇治茶）の栽培が盛んで、玉露を特産品とする。
sen.e: Tea (Ujicha) cultivation is thriving, with Gyokuro as a specialty.
sen.cmt: Gyokuro is a fine, expensive variety of tea.
sen.e: Tea (Ujicha) cultivation is thriving, with Gyokuro as a specialty.
Tea (Ujicha) cultivation is thriving, with Gyokuro as a specialty.

sen.j: 市の代表駅として、近鉄新田辺駅・JR京田辺駅・松井山手駅がある。
sen.e: The city's best known stations are Kintetsu Tanabe Station, JR Kyoutanabe Station, and Matsui Yamate Station.
The city's best known stations are Kintetsu Shintanabe Station, JR Kyoutanabe Station, and Matsui Yamate Station.
The city's best known stations are Kintetsu Shintanabe Station, JR Kyoutanabe Station, and Matsui Yamate Station.

sen.j: 近鉄新田辺駅とJR京田辺駅は京田辺市街の中心、松井山手駅は京阪東ローズタウンの中心駅として機能している。
sen.e: Kintetsu Shintanabe and JR Kyoutanabe Stations function as the center of Kyoutanabe City's downtown, while Matsui Yamate Station is at the heart of Keihan East Rose Town.
Kintetsu Shintanabe and JR Kyoutanabe Stations function as the center of Kyoutanabe City's downtown, while Matsui Yamate Station is at the heart of Keihan East Rose Town.
Kintetsu Shintanabe and JR Kyoutanabe Stations function as the center of Kyoutanabe City's downtown, while Matsui Yamate Station is at the heart of Keihan East Rose Town.

sen.j: また近鉄新田辺駅には、京都市営地下鉄烏丸線の普通電車が同駅まで乗り入れている。
sen.e: Regular trains on the Kyoto Metropolitan Subway Karasuma Line also stop at the Kintetsu Shintanabe Station.
Regular trains on the Kyoto Subway Karasuma Line also stop at the Kintetsu Shintanabe Station.
sen.cmt: Metropolitanを削除して自然な表現に修正。
sen.e: Regular trains on the Kyoto Subway Karasuma Line also stop at the Kintetsu Shintanabe Station.

sen.j: JR京田辺駅は、もとは田辺という駅名で、市制施行とほぼ同時期に市名に合わせて改名した。
sen.e: JR Kyoutanabe Station was originally called Tanabe Station, but was changed at around the same time as the city was incorporated.
JR Kyoutanabe Station was originally called Tanabe Station, but was changed at around the same time as the city was incorporated.
JR Kyoutanabe Station was originally called Tanabe Station, but was changed at around the same time as the city was incorporated.

sen.j: これは、阪急京都本線西向日駅、東向日駅と同様のケースである。
sen.e: This is the same as in the case of Nishimukou and Higashimukou Stations on the Hankyuu Kyoto Main Line.
This is the same as in the case of Nishimukou and Higashimukou Stations on the Hankyuu Kyoto Main Line.
This is the same as in the case of Nishimukou and Higashimukou Stations on the Hankyuu Kyoto Main Line.

sen.j: （和歌山県田辺市には「紀伊田辺駅」駅（紀勢本線）があるが、田辺市の方にある駅の名称に『紀伊』という和歌山県の旧国名がつくのは、同じ西日本旅客鉄道の管内で駅名の重複を避けるためと見られる）。
sen.e: (In Tanabe City, Wakayama Prefecture, there is a Kiitanabe Station (Kisei Main Line); it is possible that the addition of 'Kii', the old name for the Wakayama area, to the name of the station was a decision by the administration of the West Japan Passenger Railway to avoid duplicate station names.)

(In Tanabe City, Wakayama Prefecture, there is a Kiitanabe Station (Kisei Main Line); it is possible that the addition of 'Kii', the old name for the Wakayama area, to the name of the station was a decision by the administration of the West Japan Railway to avoid duplicate station names.)
